label: 黑暗档案怪物图鉴 Dark Archive Bestiary

Bounding Hounds.name: Bounding Hounds
Bounding Hounds.disable: @Check[type:nature|dc:36|name:Calm Hound] (expert) to calm each hound, or @Check[type:occultism|dc:38|name:Banish Hound] (master) to banish each hound
Bounding Hounds.hazarddescription: Three phantom hounds chase down intruders, damaging any they pass through.
Bounding Hounds.routine: (9 actions) The trap loses 3 actions each round for each hound disabled. Each hound uses three actions to Stride 40 feet after creatures in the room, passing through corporeal creatures during this movement if possible. Each creature the hound moves through during its movement takes [[/r {2d8 + 7}[negative]]]{2d8 + 7 negative damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|traits:damaging-effect] negates). A creature can only be damaged by each hound once each round, no matter how many times the hound moves through their space.

Bay.name: Bay
Bay.description:
Trigger A creature enters the area

Effect The hounds manifest and bay loudly, dealing [[/r {3d10 + 16}[sonic]]]{3d10 + 16 sonic damage} to all creatures within 30 feet of the hounds (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|basic:true]). On a failed check, a creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. The trap then rolls initiative.

Call of the Void.name: Call of the Void
Call of the Void.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:34|name:Expel Magical Compulsion] or @Check[type:arcana|dc:36|name:Expel Magical Compulsion] to expel the magical compulsion from the current island and from any of the red ropes directly attached to it, darkening the rope in color. The Echo also automatically disables the hazard from any island he's standing on, and any of the red ropes directly attached to it, when he Reconstitutes from Thought on that island.
Call of the Void.hazarddescription: A supernatural compulsion to leap into the unknown exerts itself on anyone who approaches the ledge.
Call of the Void.reset: The call of the void persists as long as the Echo exists, though it doesn't activate until the Echo has rolled initiative. The hazard resets each day.
Call of the Void.routine: (1 action) The call targets all creatures adjacent to a ledge or on one of the red ropes and tugs at their minds. A creature who has already fallen this round is immune.
Call of the Void.stealthdetails: (expert) to notice a slight tugging feeling

Leap into the Unknown.name: Leap into the Unknown
Leap into the Unknown.description:
Trigger A creature enters a square adjacent to the ledge of an island or steps onto one of the red ropes

Effect The call of the void tugs at the mind of intruders, compelling them to leap off the ledge. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:34] save or @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:32|traits:action:balance] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance} or else drop off the ledge. If the creature falls off, it drops 100 feet, loops through the closed space of the mindscape, and lands in the square it fell from, taking falling damage as normal (usually [[/r {50}[bludgeoning]]]{50 bludgeoning damage}). The call of the void then rolls initiative.

Clone Mirrors.name: Clone Mirrors
Clone Mirrors.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:28|name:Reposition Mirror|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to reposition each mirror, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 25) to counteract each mirror
Clone Mirrors.hazarddescription: Two opposing mirrors spawn illusory duplicates of creatures in the hall in an unending tide.
Clone Mirrors.routine: (2 actions) This trap loses 1 action for each mirror disabled. Each mirror uses 1 action to Spawn a Reflection of a creature reflected in the mirror. The hazard can have a maximum of four reflections spawned at once.

Spawn Reflection.name: Spawn Reflection
Spawn Reflection.description:
Trigger A creature is reflected in the mirror

Effect The mirror creates a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-dark-archive.ICdVjs6JEs0YAefl]{Reflection} of the triggering creature, which Steps out of the mirror and into the hall. The trap then rolls initiative.

Anchored in Silk.name: Anchored in Silk
Anchored in Silk.description: The cocoon is incapable of movement beyond slight wriggling in place. It has no Speed and can't move or be moved, even through means such as teleportation, as the Weaver's threads tether it in place physically and astrally. The cocoon casts any spells psychically, substituting verbal and somatic components for expressions of pure unbridled will and removing the manipulate trait from its Cast a Spell action.

Give of Oneself.name: Give of Oneself
Give of Oneself.description:
Trigger The Weaver would be reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The cocoon's vitality is linked to the Weaver's. It loses [[/r 30]] Hit Points, restoring [[/r {15}[Healing]]]{15 Hit Points} to the Weaver. It can use this ability even if it would otherwise be unable to act.

In There Somewhere.name: In There Somewhere
In There Somewhere.description: Killia's individuality still rests within the cocoon, yet trying to resist assimilation. If a PC succeeds at a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:32] check on the cocoon, the cocoon takes [[/r {5d6}[mental]]]{5d6 mental damage} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as Killia's consciousness fights the Weaver. The cocoon can't be affected in this way more than once per turn.

Of Same Essence.name: Of Same Essence
Of Same Essence.description: The cocoon and the Weaver share the same essence. Its spells never affect the Weaver if they would harm him, and the Weaver can ignore the any of the cocoon's active spell effects if he desires (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.tSosbMsftXcRaQgT]{Sea of Thought}).

Confounding Portal.name: Confounding Portal
Confounding Portal.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:17|name:Scratch Out Runes|traits:action:disable-a-device] to scratch out the runes, or @Check[type:arcana|dc:16|name:Destroy the Runes] to destroy the runes
Confounding Portal.hazarddescription: Tiny runes carved around a doorframe or on a hall's walls surreptitiously confound creatures into circling the room or hallway they attempted to exit or pass through.

Confounding Misdirection.name: Confounding Misdirection
Confounding Misdirection.description:
Trigger A creature passes through the rune-carved doorway or hallway

Effect The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} by the illusions and directed back into the room they attempted to exit through another doorway or back to the hallway's beginning. This feels no different to the triggering creature than walking through the doorway or hallway, and onlookers are similarly befuddled. A creature who succeeds at a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save resists this illusion and exits the room or proceeds down the hall without being misdirected.

Constricting Hall.name: Constricting Hall
Constricting Hall.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:28|name:Stabilize Wall|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to stabilize each wall, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level; counteract DC 26) to counteract each wall
Constricting Hall.hazarddescription: A hall's four walls become fluid and elastic when a creature reaches the hall's midpoint.
Constricting Hall.routine: (4 actions) This trap loses 1 action each round for each wall that has been disabled. Each wall uses 1 action to slam back and forth rapidly, pummeling one creature in the hall with a wall Strike. On a hit, the target is additionally knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The walls distribute the attacks as evenly as possible among creatures in the hall, and the Strikes don't apply the trap's multiple attack penalty.

Lose Form.name: Lose Form
Lose Form.description:
Trigger A creature reaches the hall's midpoint

Effect The hall's walls lose their rigidity, becoming fluid and elastic. The hall becomes difficult terrain, and each creature in the hall is knocked Archive @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} unless they succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Disorienting Illusions.name: Disorienting Illusions
Disorienting Illusions.disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:17|name:Calculate the Room's Dimensions] (trained) to calculate the room's dimensions despite the illusions, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st level; counteract DC 17) to counteract the illusions
Disorienting Illusions.hazarddescription: Illusions cloaking this chamber cause it to appear distorted and constantly shifting, with the room and all its contents appearing tilted, irregular, and in motion.

Disorient.name: Disorient
Disorient.description:
Trigger A creature enters the room

Effect Illusions cause the appearance of the room and the objects inside it to constantly warp, shift, bend, and distort for 1 minute. Each creature in the room while it's distorting must attempt a @Check[type:perception|dc:17|action:seek] check.

Critical Success The creature disbelieves the illusions and is unaffected.

Success The creature disbelieves the illusions but still sees them. It treats the room as difficult terrain.

Failure The creature is fooled by the illusions. It treats the room as difficult terrain and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. As long as it remains in the room, it can't reduce its sickened value below 1.

Critical Failure As failure, but each time the creature Archive attempts a move action, it must succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] or they lose the action, and on a critical failure, it also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Distortion Mirror.name: Distortion Mirror
Distortion Mirror.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:38|name:Deface the Mirror|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to deface the mirror's pane, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level; counteract DC 36) to dispel the mirror or counteract the transformation
Distortion Mirror.hazarddescription: Fun-house mirrors distort a viewer's reflection, painfully reshaping their body to match what appears in the reflected images.

Painful Transformation.name: Painful Transformation
Painful Transformation.description:
Trigger A creature is reflected in the mirror

Effect The triggering creature's body is painfully squished, stretched, and distorted to match their reflection. The creature takes [[/r {6d10 + 30}[force]]]{6d10 + 30 force damage} and must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 4 rounds.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is clumsy 2 and enfeebled 2 for 1 minute. As long as the creature is clumsy or enfeebled, it additionally takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

When the effects of this trap end, the triggering creature's transformation ends, and its body reverts to its natural form.

Entrapping Chair.name: Entrapping Chair
Entrapping Chair.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Disrupt the Tracks|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to disrupt the tracks
Entrapping Chair.hazarddescription: A chair on concealed tracks surges forward, knocking a creature into the chair's seat and trapping them in place with clamping armrests.
Entrapping Chair.reset: The trap resets automatically over 2 rounds if the chair is unoccupied.

Take a Seat!.name: Take a Seat!
Take a Seat!.description:
Trigger A creature steps on the track

Effect The chair rockets forward along the track and slams into the triggering creature, dealing [[/r {3d8 + 15}[bludgeoning]]]{3d8 + 15 bludgeoning damage}. A creature who succeeds at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:22|traits:damaging-effect] save takes no damage and moves out of the chair's path into a random adjacent square not containing the track. A creature who fails this saving throw is knocked into the chair's seat and immediately captured by the armrests, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} on a critical failure; Escape DC 26).

Exhaling Portal.name: Exhaling Portal
Exhaling Portal.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:30|name:Scratch Out Runes|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) twice to scratch out the runes, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th level; counteract DC 30) to counteract the planar runes; @Check[type:athletics|dc:32|name:Shut the Door] to shut the door if it's open (using Athletics only stops the trap, it doesn't fully disable it)
Exhaling Portal.hazarddescription: Magic runes carved into a doorframe connect a door to the Plane of Air when opened, blowing creatures down the connecting hall.
Exhaling Portal.routine: (1 action) The trap uses 1 action to blow powerful winds down the hall. Each creature in the hall must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save with the same results as Gust. If this forced movement would cause a creature to collide with a solid object or fall downstairs or out a window, that creature takes an additional [[/r {2d10 + 11}[bludgeoning]]]{2d10 + 11 bludgeoning damage} (or [[/r {20}[bludgeoning]]]{20 damage} due to a fall).

Gust.name: Gust
Gust.description:
Trigger A creature opens the door

Effect The hall is buffeted by powerful winds for as long as the door remains open. A creature must succeed at a @Check[type:athletics|dc:32] check to move toward the door. A creature who fails at this check is pushed back 5 feet and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Additionally, the triggering creature is blasted by a powerful gust of wind and must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is pushed back 5 feet.

Failure The creature is pushed back 10 feet.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed back 10 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

False Floor.name: False Floor
False Floor.disable: Succeeding on a Perception check against the Stealth DC of 21 (including the check to find the trap) disbelieves the illusory floor, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 18) to dispel the illusory floor; dispel magic (2nd level; counteract DC 20) to dispel the magical silence
False Floor.hazarddescription: The floor in this chamber is an illusion, which conceals a 40-foot drop to the true floor below. Additionally, the area beneath the floor is magically silenced-no sound is audible within nor does sound leave this space.
False Floor.stealthdetails: (trained; or 0 if the illusory floor is dispelled)

Drop.name: Drop
Drop.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the illusory floor

Effect The triggering creature falls through the illusory floor and takes falling damage (typically [[/r {20}[bludgeoning]]]{20 bludgeoning Damage}). That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls (@Check[type:athletics|dc:20|traits:action:climb]) or Grab an Edge is @Check[type:reflex|dc:20|traits:action:grab-an-edge].

False Step Floor.name: False Step Floor
False Step Floor.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:28|name:Disrupt the Magical Energy|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disrupt the magical energy, or @Check[type:arcana|dc:27|name:Realign the Magic] or @Check[type:occultism|dc:27|name:Realign the Magic] (trained) to realign the magical energy
False Step Floor.hazarddescription: Each time a creature enters the room, it slips through the floor, tumbles through an interdimensional void, and falls back into the room through the ceiling, landing on the floor.

False Step.name: False Step
False Step.description:
Trigger A creature enters the room and steps onto the floor

Effect The creature slips through the floor; it tumbles through an interdimensional void before falling back into the room through the ceiling and landing on the floor. The triggering creature takes [[/r {40}[bludgeoning]]]{40 bludgeoning Damage} from the fall. That creature can try to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} (DC 24) to avoid falling.

Attack of Opportunity.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
The Echo has reach 15 for the purpose of determining when Attack of Opportunity triggers and when making Attacks of Opportunity.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

Destabilized Form.name: Destabilized Form
Destabilized Form.description:
When the Echo has fewer than 140 Hit Points, his form destabilizes, large chunks disintegrating from his face, limbs, and torso. White moths constantly stream from the missing spaces, creating a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] that deals [[/r {6d6}[mental]]]{6d6 mental damage} with a @Check[type:will|dc:34|basic:true].

As long as the aura persists, he can dissolve into moths and re-form at another location within 15 feet as a free action at the beginning of each of his turns; this has the occult, conjuration, and teleportation traits.

Astral Spindel Implement.name: Astral Spindel Implement
Astral Spindel Implement.description: The Echo carries a drop spindle that constantly spins red astral thread, which is both his thaumaturgic implement and weapon. If his rope dart is lost or broken, he can re-form it with an Interact action. If he critically succeeds at a rope dart Strike, overwhelming thoughts and figments flow down the thread into the target's mind. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Astral Thread Control.name: Astral Thread Control
Astral Thread Control.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The Echo's previous action was a successful thrown rope dart Strike

Effect The Echo flicks his wrist and makes a follow-up thrown rope dart Strike at a different target within 30 feet of the first target, using the same multiple attack penalty as his previous Strike. Regardless of whether his attack hits, he then retrieves the weapon.

Contingency Oathday-Nine-Rova.name: Contingency Oathday-Nine-Rova
Contingency Oathday-Nine-Rova.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The Echo's turn begins and he's stunned, slowed, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or otherwise can't act

Effect The Echo has set up numerous contingencies in the event he's compromised. Talismans on his body shatter, counteracting the triggering effect. The Echo can use this free action even if he can't act.

Reconstitute from Thought.name: Reconstitute from Thought
Reconstitute from Thought.description:
Requirements The Echo is standing on one of the eight large islands of the map, and the island hasn't darkened

Effect The Echo throws his rope dart into the island and uses it to absorb mental essence from the mindscape, repairing himself. He regains [[/r {45}[healing]]]{45 Hit Points} and the island turns a desaturated gray for 1 day, preventing future absorption and disabling the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-dark-archive.0AdtolhMWrPlzVZY]{Call of the Void} hazard on that island.

Spindle's Web.name: Spindle's Web
Spindle's Web.description:
The Echo's spindle revolves faster and faster until it's a blur, lashing red threads in every direction. The threads deal [[/r {7d6}[slashing] + {7d6}[mental]]]]]{7d6 slashing damage and 7d6 mental damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30], with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true]. If a creature fails its save, the threads awaken the mindscape an

chor within it, affecting it differently based on which anchor that creature used to gain access to the center of the mindscape. (If there is a PC who didn't absorb a mindscape anchor, for instance because there are more than four PCs in the party, then use the anchor of the PC closest to them.)

The Echo then can't use Spindle's Web for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Lantern The lantern outlines the creature with searing @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire} that deals [[/r {2d6}[persistent,fire]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}.
  • Mirror The mirror reflects the creature to another location, teleporting them to a clear space within 25 feet of their current location.
  • Chalice The chalice drains life force, granting the Echo temporary HP equal to half the damage dealt.
  • Tome The tome floods the creature's mind with information; the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Mirror Door.name: Mirror Door
Mirror Door.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|name:Open the Door|traits:action:disable-a-device] to open the door while viewing the reflection
Mirror Door.hazarddescription: The reflection of a wall shows a phantom door where none exists. This door can only be manipulated while viewed through the mirror's reflection.

Appear.name: Appear
Appear.description:
Trigger A creature views the wall through a mirror's reflection

Effect A door appears in the mirror's reflection of the wall. The triggering creature can open and manipulate this door only as long as they view it through the mirror and only by succeeding at a @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|name:Disable the Trap|traits:action:disable-a-device] check to disable the trap.

Crystal Vitality Link.name: Crystal Vitality Link
Crystal Vitality Link.description: The power of the island links Mitera's vitality to her followers. As long as any of the three quartz formations are intact, whenever Mitera takes damage, any of her followers within 10 miles lose the same amount of Hit Points.

Ascension is Near.name: Ascension is Near
Ascension is Near.description:
Frequency once per ascension ritual

Effect Mitera activates the moonflower link with her followers. Any followers within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} who failed their saving throw against the moonflower tea become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Anyone who critically failed and did not receive an antidote explodes (this is about half of Mitera's congregation if the PCs didn't successfully administer the antidote). If anyone's body explodes, Mitera gains 30 temporary Hit Points and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 3 rounds; she can use this additional action each round only for Strike and Stride actions.

Quartz-Spawned Shadow.name: Quartz-Spawned Shadow
Quartz-Spawned Shadow.publicNotes: The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light. Those who parley with shadows, typically by keeping them at bay with a glowing weapon, may learn great secrets, for they are ideal spies.

Light Vulnerability.name: Light Vulnerability
Light Vulnerability.description: An object shedding magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell) is treated as magical when used to attack the shadow.

Crystal Siphon.name: Crystal Siphon
Crystal Siphon.description:
Requirements The shadow and the target are both within 40 feet of the crystal that spawned the shadow, and the crystal isn't covered or obstructed

Effect Shadows in the shape of tendrils curl around the target, drawing out a portion of the target's vitality and siphoning it into the crystal. The target takes [[/r {4d6}[negative]]]{4d6 negative damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|basic:true]). On a failure, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}. This enfeebled condition is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from quartz-spawned shadows, to a maximum of enfeebled 4. If Crystal Siphon increases the creature's enfeebled value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is pulled entirely into the shadow's crystal.

While the target's shadow is trapped, they feel an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} tether linking them to the crystal, and they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} whenever they are more than 40 feet away from it. The enfeebled condition from Crystal Siphon can't be reduced until the crystal is broken; if the crystal is broken, the effect immediately ends.

Slink in Shadows.name: Slink in Shadows
Slink in Shadows.description: The shadow can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

Reflected Desires.name: Reflected Desires
Reflected Desires.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|name:Shroud the Mirror|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to shroud the mirror without looking at it, or @Check[type:occultism|dc:17|name:Erect Mental Barriers] (trained) to erect mental barriers
Reflected Desires.hazarddescription: This mirror reflects the viewer's deepest desires.

Tempt.name: Tempt
Tempt.description:
Trigger A creature looks into the mirror

Effect The triggering creature sees themselves enjoying their deepest desires in the mirror's reflection, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} (@Check[type:will|dc:20] negates). This fascination ends automatically when the mirror is broken or covered up.

Reflection Routine.name: Reflection Routine
Reflection Routine.description: Each reflection has 2 actions which it uses to Step, Stride, or Strike (in any combination). Reflections can act on the same turn they're created.

Shrinking Hall.name: Shrinking Hall
Shrinking Hall.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Jam the Scales|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to jam the scales built into the floor
Shrinking Hall.hazarddescription: This hallway is designed to shrink as creatures traverse it, making access to the door at the hall's end impossible.
Shrinking Hall.reset: After 10 minutes without weight being placed on this hall's floor, this trap resets, returning the hall to its original size.

Shrink.name: Shrink
Shrink.description:
Trigger 100 pounds of weight or more is placed on the hallway's floor

Effect The hall's last 40 feet of walls angle inward, causing the hall to shrink and contract down, reaching 6 inches in height and width at the hall's far end and completely blocking access to the hall's exit door for anything but a Tiny creature Squeezing.

Shrouded Assailant.name: Shrouded Assailant
Shrouded Assailant.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:43|name:Steal the Cloth|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to steal the cloth before the spirit manifests, or @Check[type:athletics|dc:47|name:Pull the Cloth Off] to pull the cloth off the spirit after it manifests
Shrouded Assailant.hazarddescription: A spirit steps out of a covered mirror, pulling off and becoming shrouded in the cloth, which reveals the mirror. The shrouded figure attacks the living until the cloth is yanked off, which banishes the formless spirit.
Shrouded Assailant.reset: The haunt can be reset if the mirror is covered in a cloth or shroud.
Shrouded Assailant.routine: (3 actions) The spirit uses 3 actions to Step, fly 60 feet, or Strike, in any order. On a successful Strike the spirit's target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and on a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Don Shroud.name: Don Shroud
Don Shroud.description:
Trigger A creature enters the area

Effect The spirit steps out of the mirror, wearing the cloth as a shroud and revealing the mirror. The triggering creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} unless they succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:38] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Shuffling Hall.name: Shuffling Hall
Shuffling Hall.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:12|name:Deactivate a Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] to deactivate one pressure plate
Shuffling Hall.hazarddescription: Four pressure plates along this mirrored hall rotate vertically when stepped on, sending a creature on the pressure plate tipping into an adjacent featureless room while simultaneously replacing the pressure plate and walls in the hall. Each pressure plate dumps creatures into a different room.

Flip.name: Flip
Flip.description:
Trigger A creature steps on a pressure plate

Effect The floor and adjoining wall rotate up and over on a central axle, tipping the triggering creature into an adjacent featureless room and simultaneously replacing the pressure plate and wall with another set on the same axle. The triggering creature is pushed into an adjoining room, takes [[/r {1d8}[bludgeoning]]]{1d8 bludgeoning damage}, and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. A creature who succeeds at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save takes no damage and rolls out of the way of the trap, returning to the space they were in before stepping on the pressure plate.

Sigil of Deepest Fears.name: Sigil of Deepest Fears
Sigil of Deepest Fears.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:43|name:Drain the Sigil's Power|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to drain the sigil's power harmlessly, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 42) to counteract the sigil
Sigil of Deepest Fears.hazarddescription: An arcane sigil forces creatures to confront their greatest fear.

Face Your Fear.name: Face Your Fear
Face Your Fear.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 10 feet of the sigil

Effect All creatures within 120 feet of the sigil are affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.qDjeG6dxT4aEEC6J]{Weird} spell (@Check[type:will|dc:40|traits:damaging-effect] save).

Spirit Window.name: Spirit Window
Spirit Window.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:48|name:Free the Spirits] (legendary) to free the spirits from the mirror, or @Check[type:religion|dc:48|name:Banish the Spirits] (legendary) to banish the spirits
Spirit Window.hazarddescription: Spirits trapped inside a haunted window harm those who touch the window.

Siphon Soul.name: Siphon Soul
Siphon Soul.description:
Trigger A creature touches the window

Effect The triggering creature takes [[/r {8d10 + 44}[negative]]]{8d10 + 44 negative damage} (@Check[type:will|dc:42|basic:true]) as the window attempts to steal their soul. If this damage would kill the target, its soul is trapped inside the window with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Bind Soul}.

Thalassophobic Pool.name: Thalassophobic Pool
Thalassophobic Pool.disable: @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:32|name:Calm the Pool] (master) or @Check[type:deception|dc:32|name:Calm the Pool] (master) to quell the fear and calm the pool or @Check[type:intimidation|dc:35|name:Scare the Pool] to give the pool something worse to fear; three successes required.
Thalassophobic Pool.hazarddescription: The pool sucks in creatures that fall into it, making them sink into its endless depths.
Thalassophobic Pool.reset: The trap resets once there are no moving creatures in it.
Thalassophobic Pool.routine: (3 actions) Water from the chalice increases the depth of the water by 10 feet for each action. Each time this happens, creatures in the pool are pushed 10 feet down and take [[/r {1d6}[bludgeoning]]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage}. As the pool has no bottom, creatures in it can fall down indefinitely; they must @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim} up to avoid drowning, but the water is especially choppy, so the Athletics DC is @Check[type:athletics|dc:25|traits:action:swim]. The pool never overflows. Each successful check to Disable reduces the pool's actions by 1, and once the pool is completely Disabled, the water becomes still and the Athletics DC to Swim becomes @Check[type:athletics|dc:10|traits:action:swim].

Downpour.name: Downpour
Downpour.description:
Trigger A creature falls into the pool

Effect More water pours forth from the chalice. Creatures in the pool become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and they can't decrease their clumsy condition so long as they remain in the pool. The trap then rolls initiative.

Dreams Unraveling.name: Dreams Unraveling
Dreams Unraveling.description: When the Weaver has fewer than 155 Hit Points, his form partially unravels, revealing patches of pure horror acute enough to leave physical wounds. This creates a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] that deals [[/r {3d6}[mental]+{3d6}[slashing]]]{3d6 mental damage and 3d6 slashing damage}, with a @Check[type:will|dc:36|basic:true]. A creature Averting its Gaze is immune to the aura.

Nameless Nightmare.name: Nameless Nightmare
Nameless Nightmare.description: The Weaver has torn off his own name to become a being of fear. He is immune to linguistic effects and any effect that would impose the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition. Without a name, he is difficult for phenomena to affect; the Weaver recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} conditions at the end of his turn, and his flat check to clear persistent damage is @Check[type:flat|dc:5]{5}. If anyone utters, writes, or otherwise attempts to record his name, that creature automatically takes [[/r {10}[mental]]]{10 mental Damage} and the attempt fails.

Stitch Into the Web.name: Stitch Into the Web
Stitch Into the Web.description:
Trigger The Weaver is moved against his will, or a creature attempts to leave a square within 20 feet of him by any means, including teleportation

Effect The Weaver's silk stitches a body in place to prevent movement. The creature stops moving and the action is disrupted. The disruption doesn't affect astral bodies.

Separate Astral Body.name: Separate Astral Body
Separate Astral Body.description: The Weaver buries a silk thread in the target's psyche and tugs, wrenching the target's astral form out of their body. Unless the target succeeds at a @Check[type:will|dc:36] save, their astral form is pulled out, causing a ghostly image of them to appear in an adjacent space of the Weaver's choosing. An astral body is immune to physical damage but affected normally by mental effects, force effects, and effects that directly target the spirit. The target remains connected to their physical body by a silver cord, which is always visible and possibly foils attempts to Hide. Separation from one's astral body takes a toll on the psyche, imposing a -1 status penalty to Will saves and dealing [[/r {1d6}[persistent,mental]]]{1d6} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent mental Damage} for as long as the body is separated; this increases to 3d6 if the target is ever more than 30 feet from its astral body. The target can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to move their astral body an amount equal to their Speed. When the target stops taking persistent mental damage from this ability, the astral body snaps back to the physical body, ending the effect. If a target is carrying silver, then the first time this ability is used on them, the ability fails and any silver they're carrying larger than a coin tarnishes-while this doesn't outright destroy items like weapons or thaumaturge implements, it does prevent them from protecting against this ability more than once.

Sever Astral Threads.name: Sever Astral Threads
Sever Astral Threads.description: The Weaver uses a claw to cut the silver cord connecting a creature's astral and physical bodies. This deals [[/r {16d6}[mental]]]{16d6 mental damage} to any target affected by Separate Astral Body whose physical or astral body is within 10 feet of the Weaver (@Check[type:will|dc:37|basic:true]). After being targeted by this ability, the astral body slams violently back into the target's physical body, causing the target's vision to swim and blinding them until the start of their next turn unless they critically succeeded at their saving throw.

Stalker in Dreams.name: Stalker in Dreams
Stalker in Dreams.description:
Trigger The Weaver becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to all creatures within 60 feet or is not observed by any creatures within 60 feet

Effect The Weaver's presence on the Material Plane is connected to others' perception of him, and when that perception falters, he can skitter to a new location. The Weaver teleports to an unoccupied space within 60 feet not within line of sight of any creatures within 60 feet. If the Weaver became concealed or unobserved as part of a movement action he was taking, he can resume its movement after teleporting. A creature who Averts its Gaze from the Weaver is not observing him.

String Astral Body.name: String Astral Body
String Astral Body.description: The Weaver attaches strings to a creature's astral body to move it. He forcefully moves an exposed astral body within reach of his astral silk Strike up to 20 feet, with no saving throw.

Verdure's Moonflower.name: Verdure's Moonflower
Verdure's Moonflower.publicNotes:
These enormous plants have thick, knotted trunks festooned with fanged blossoms. A gaping mouth sits at the top of the trunk, capable of swallowing most creatures smaller than the moonflower whole. Moonflowers can move slowly on their powerful roots or use them to attack, but usually they dig them deeply into the surrounding ground and remain stationary to await prey.

Though moonflowers can't speak in the conventional sense, they communicate telepathically with other moonflowers. Explorers who encounter a single moonflower can thus be assured that any other moonflowers in the vicinity will be prepared for them. Those who manage to intercept a moonflower's telepathic communications are assaulted by visions of dreadful, primeval jungles ruled over by titanic plant life. Whether this is some vision of the past or a dream of the future shared by all moonflowers is unknown.

Moonflowers are alien life-forms from a long-dead planet, but their proliferation throughout the galaxy has been ensured through the machinations of the Dominion of the Black, a sinister, alien organization from the dark places between the stars.

Pod Prison.name: Pod Prison
Pod Prison.description:
Trigger The moonflower has swallowed a creature

Effect The swallowed creature is wrapped in a tight cocoon and extruded from the moonflower's body into an adjacent square. The creature continues to be Swallowed Whole. It can't use Acrobatics to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} a pod, but other creatures can attempt to Rupture the pod. The cocooned creature takes half damage from any damage dealt to the cocoon. Once the cocoon is Ruptured, it deflates and decays.

Pod Spawn.name: Pod Spawn
Pod Spawn.description:
Should a Small or larger creature die within a pod prison, the pod transforms into an adult moonflower with full Hit Points after [[/br 1d4 #Moonflower Transformation]]{1d4 hours} of growth.

The newly formed moonflower has its own consciousness, but some aspect of its trunk or blossoms resembles the creature that died within. The dead creature's equipment remains inside the new moonflower and can be retrieved if the moonflower is slain.

Spray Blossoms.name: Spray Blossoms
Spray Blossoms.description:
Effect The moonflower expels mindwarping petals in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take [[/r {4d6}[mental] + {4d6}[poison]]]{4d6 mental damage and 4d6 poison damage} (@Check[type:will|dc:26|basic:true]). On a failure, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute, and on a critical failure, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

The moonflower can't Spray Blossoms again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Disgusted by Food.name: 厌恶食物 Disgusted by Food
Disgusted by Food.description: 来日魔吞噬梦境和潜能，而非食物。一个生物可以花费一个动作来在来日魔面前挥舞食物，会使得来日魔自动陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（或增加其恶心状态值1，最大到恶心6），如通常的恶心状态一样，降低来日魔的AC，攻击骰，豁免，技能，和属性DC。来日魔无法通过呕吐来减少其恶心状态值。

Endless.name: 不息 Endless
Endless.description: 如果来日魔减少至0生命值或陷入失去意识超过数轮，它会消失。1分钟后，它完全恢复再次现身，如同上一场战斗根本没有发生过，它恢复满生命值，清除它身上所有效果，且其吞噬未来能力也准备就绪可以再次使用。

Drain Potential.name: 汲取潜能 Drain Potential
Drain Potential.description: 来日魔试图汲取其目标的积极性，目标必须尝试一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:31]的强韧豁免。如果目标豁免失败，它将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}（大失败时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}），且在1分钟内所有检定上必须掷骰两次采用较差的结果。穿戴有希望护符（hope talisman）的生物不受影响。

Swallow Future.name: 吞噬未来 Swallow Future
Swallow Future.description:
来日魔吸取抓住周围所有生物的未来行为。来日魔@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的所有生物受到[[/r {6d8 + 18}[mental]]]{6d8 + 18心灵伤害}，且必须尝试一次@Check[type:will|dc:39]豁免。

来日魔无法在1分钟内再次使用吞噬未来。

穿戴有希望护符的生物可以在看到意志豁免结果后，选择让他们的希望护符破碎来忽视此效果。

大成功 生物不受伤害。

成功 生物受到一半伤害并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。

失败 生物受到全额伤害并陷入毁灭2@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}。

大失败 生物受到双倍伤害并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 4}（可能导致其立即死亡）。

Tomorrow's Fury.name: 明日狂暴 Tomorrow's Fury
Tomorrow's Fury.description: 来日魔对其触及范围内任意数量的目标进行爪抓攻击。爪抓攻击会计入来日魔的多重攻击减值，但只有在所有攻击完成后才会累积减值。
